basics.description:
### Create a Windows Server VM running Intel Endpoint Management Assistant (Intel® EMA)  
 [Learn more about Intel® EMA](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000056028/software/manageability-products.html). 

 This template will create a virtual machine, install the first server in an Intel EMA distributed server architecture and perform minimal configuration.  It will acquire a free certificate from Let's Encrypt based on the FQDN assigned during the virtual machine creation. 

 Questions about this template?  Check out the Intel EMA CloudStart tool for Azure Guide. 

[Intel® EMA CloudStart tool for Azure Guide](https://downloadmirror.intel.com/30201/Intel%20EMA%20Cloud%20Start%20Tool%20for%20Azure%202.0%20-%20%20Quick-Start%20Guide.pdf).

basics.name: sqlDBName

constraints.validationMessage: The database name must be between 3 and 15 characters long and contain dashes, underscores, letters and numbers only.

options.text: NOTE: There may be substantial fees associated with this SQL license.  Please refer to your agreement for details.
Select the box below and complete each of the fields to join the newly created virtual machine to an exsiting Active Directory infrastructure and use Active Directory authentication for Intel EMA.

The virtual network and subnet selected above in the "Configure virtual networks" section must be able to access your Active Directory infrastructure.  Specify the username in UPN format, the Active Directory domain to join and the DNS servers that can resolve the domain.

basics.name: adJoin
basics.label:
Join an Active Directory domain
(leave unchecked if not joining AD)

constraints.validationMessage: Select to join an Active Directory domain.

basics.name: adUsername
basics.label: Active Directory account
basics.toolTip: Active Directory account with permissions to join computers to the domain.

constraints.validationMessage: Username must be in UPN (user@domain.com) format.

basics.name: adPassword
basics.toolTip: Password for the Active Directory account.

constraints.validationMessage: Password must be at least 8 characters long, and must contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol

basics.name: adDomain
basics.label: Active Directory domain (UPN suffix)
basics.toolTip: Name of the Active Directory domain to join.

constraints.validationMessage: The Active Directory domain must be between 3 and 35 characters long and contain letters, numbers, hyphens and periods only.

basics.name: adDNSpri
basics.label: Primary DNS
basics.toolTip: Primary DNS server for Active Directory clients.

constraints.validationMessage: The primary DNS server must be a valid IP address of a DNS server for your Active Directory domain.

basics.name: adDNSsec
basics.label: Secondary DNS
basics.toolTip: Secondary DNS server for Active Directory clients.

constraints.validationMessage: The secondary DNS server must be a valid IP address of a DNS server for your Active Directory domain.

options.text: If using Active Directory, the user accounts must exist before specifying below.  Accepting the defaults will re-use the Tenant Admin password for the Endpoint Group and Auto-Setup passwords.  Usernames must be specified in email address/UPN format.
For a description of each of the parameters required below, please review section 5 of the Intel EMA Quick Start Guide.
Questions about this template?  Check out the Intel EMA CloudStart Tool for Azure Guide.

link.label: Intel EMA CloudStart Tool for Azure Guide

basics.name: globalUsername
basics.label: Global Admin
basics.toolTip: Active Directory account to use as the Intel EMA Global Administrator account OR create a normal account if not joining an Active Directory domain.

constraints.validationMessage: Username must be in UPN/email address (user@domain.com) format.

basics.name: globalPassword
basics.toolTip: Password for the Intel EMA Global Administrator account.

constraints.validationMessage: Password must be at least 8 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol.  Some special characters are not permitted to begin or end the password.

basics.name: tenantUsername
basics.label: Tenant Admin
basics.toolTip: Active Directory account to use as the Intel EMA Tenant Administrator account OR create a normal account if not joining an Active Directory domain.

validations.message: Global and Tenant admin usernames must be different.

constraints.validationMessage: Username must be in UPN/email address (user@domain.com) format.

basics.name: tenantPassword
basics.toolTip: Password for the Intel EMA Tenant Administrator account.

constraints.validationMessage: Password must be at least 8 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol.  Some special characters are not permitted to begin or end the password.

options.text: Select the box below and complete each of the fields to customize additional Intel EMA configuration parameters.

Customize configuration parameters
(leave unchecked to accept defaults)

constraints.validationMessage: Select to specify additional parameters.

options.text: Select the checkbox below to customize the Intel EMA fully qualified domain name.  This option is necessary if load balancing will be used in a distributed architecture, use of a custom domain named is desired, etc.

basics.name: emaCustom
basics.label:
Customize the Intel EMA FQDN
(leave unchecked if using VM FQDN)

constraints.validationMessage: Select to customize the Intel EMA FQDN.

options.text: NOTE: The FQDN specified below must be publicly resolvable prior to deploying this template.  This can be accomplished by creating a CNAME record that points to the resulting Azure public name.  For example, if the VM name is “ema“ and it was created in the East US region, the FQDN CNAME record would point to “ema.eastus.cloudapp.azure.com“

elements.label: Intel EMA FQDN
